1.content:
I have been a gray and then a black case once. My journey in Writing.com started in June, 2001.
I hope your journeys in writing last till eternity!
Here is a starter, a poem I wrote once.

Just Words

Pay no mind,
these are just words
trying to be cute
and to take flight,
yet, self-conscious
for lack of courage.

Reckless,
though they remain wreck-less,
for they do not kill dreams
or belittle
any heart that sings.

Without fists or stones,
these words face
themselves alone,
since they sense that,
if tongues coincide
with pompous hysteria,
like fate and winds,
they can manage to devastate
wings and wishes.
1.title: Welcome!

11.content:
While I still have a good amount of life left to live (I think), I have found in my life so far that timing is everything. I mean, who would expect me to find a new love right as my mom's lung cancer was about to take a turn for the worse? And who knew that a loud brewery would be the place I'd find it (and in front of my boss to boot)?

A rainy Tuesday night found me sitting at a table with my team from work. I ended up sitting between a couple guys I don't chat with often, one of them being Marty. Marty and I talked far more than I expected, although the surprise got started early when he refused to scoot over a seat to sit next to one of his work buddies. That meant I got two hours next to Marty, making him laugh with my macabre jokes about what you could possibly run over in his old (trendy) neighborhood. I'd have blamed the IPA for all this, but given we all got to the brewery right after work, I doubt Marty had been pregaming before deciding that sitting next to me was the best way for him to spend the next two hours. I also couldn't blame my outfit, as I'd managed to throw a sweater over my white blouse before running out into the rain to get from the office to my car. I'm not sure what made us keep coming back to chatting with each other. All I know id it took a lot of self control to stay when he decided to leave for the evening. Once he left, I had to put in a lot of effort to not betray how deflated I felt by his absence.

Two weeks later, I got the call from my dad that my mom was in hospice and that she was too weak to go home. Before I knew it, my team had pitched in on a card offering condolences for my mom's death. From there, every day was an emotional minefield. Marty somehow had figured out how to disarm some of the IEDs littering my brain along the way. Whether it was by the head scratching capitalization of my name in the team sympathy card; trying to find me good non-chocolate candy; or trying to impress me with his trick to get fresher coffee, Marty always had something up his sleeve to boost my mood, if only for a bit. On the other hand, sometimes his actions left me more baffled. I know my social skills haven't evolved past fifth or sixth grade, but still.

Things came to a head three months after the happy hour. This time it was a team dinner at an Indian restaurant. Hey, we gotta accommodate our vegan coworkers somehow. Anyway, Marty's boss coordinated everything down to the seating chart. Marty and I sat next to each other again, an arrangement I had a lot of trouble believing was a coincidence. Sipping on my strawberry lassi and nibbling on vegetable samosas, I first tried to focus on the rest of the group (including some people who flew in from the East Coast), but Marty's unusual quietness kept tugging at me. I shifted my attention to him and discovered that not only had he gotten turned down for a promotion but that his wife had no interest in their marriage anymore. He then admitted that he was kind of relieved about the second part because he'd had doubts about that part of his life the day I joined the team. I almost choked on my lassi when he told me this. We ended up ignoring the rest of the group for much of the night as we ruminated over our feelings and the last three months being upheaval after upheaval. Before we left, we exchanged phone numbers but decided to hold off on pursuing anything with each other while we tried to adjust to our respective traumas.

We exchanged phone numbers three years ago. Now we share a condo with my husband and cats, alternating between watching the Winter Olympics and going to your cabin for (ahem) photo shoots. Fate really is unbelievable sometimes.
11.title: Fate is unbelievable

choices: open, you decide what to write about
112.content:
I don't want to come off as a complainer; however, I have had more than my fair share of traumas in my life. Starting at my twenty-first birthday after my husband and I had been trying, unsuccessfully, to get me pregnant. I went to the doctor for a medical checkup; She told me I had a condition called endometriosis and I would have to have a hysterectomy. I guess you can say I was one of the lucky ones because it was not cancerous. But here it is and I'm fifty- four and still have no children. Yet my husband and I have always taken in all of the strays in the neighborhood and fed them and gave them shelter from the weather.

my husband was injured in 2000, at the water company, where he worked. He was hurt using a jackhammer, and it was a terrible back injury. He was unable to return to do manual labor, so he took some exams and passed them, from the Environmental Protection Agency, (EPA}. He was promised a good job as a water plant operator, but then the boss's nephew needed a job and they gave it to him.

That same year I got a job at our local newspaper as a staff writer. I was constantly harassed and belittled by another writer, until finally I told her off and told them what they could do with that job. I worked for a radio station as a reporter and on-air news person and most of the people I know began treating me differently. People who never liked me or even knew me before, where suddenly smothering me with attention. but when I got sick and had to leave the job they were nowhere around to befriend me or help me.

I was in a terrible car accident and almost killed when I passed out while driving on a one-lane road on my way home. I could see my house from where I wrecked.
My husband heard me scream and ran to my car, getting me out he then rushed me to the hospital in a neighbor's van. I had the biggest quack for a doctor that exists. He did not diagnose my broken ribs, which all of my ribs were broken one side, both my arms were broken, one on the shoulder and one on the wrist. it was a nightmare.
I then proceeded to get pneumonia as I usually did, but this time, with broken ribs, I couldn't cough anything up. I came in an ace of dying, I was in ICU for so long I can't remember how long it was though.

I was then diagnosed with a rare lung disease and put on a ventilator for a while, then when finally I got to go home, they sent me home on oxygen for the rest of my life.
I have spent months in the hospital for illnesses to my lungs and broken bones due to the fact I developed Osteoporosis.

My husband went away somewhere for about a year and I had to move in with my mother during this time, I was unable to stay by myself. While staying with her a friend, or at least I thought he was! He said he would stay at my house, watch my cats and take care of things around the house. It turns out, The old thing robbed me! He took everything I owned, then he vandalized the property, stealing all the wiring, shower, hot- water heater, and he left the place a wreck. Go figure people, I can't...
I reported him to the police, they even caught him with a charge card he got out of my mailbox, but they did nothing to him but take the card from him. It turns out he is an
informant for them and makes drug buys while wearing a wire. I know that he himself uses strong drugs, like meth. But He got by with stealing my identity and using all these charges in my name and my husbands.

That is just a few of the traumas we have been through, to me life is trauma.
But I wouldn't change mine, I love the people God put in my life.
112.title: Our respective traumas

choices: Since she likes the hotel so much, I buy it and...
The company I work in moves to...
1122.content:
When I have decided to leave my wife it is because I wanted to search for a better way to earn much money. I have talked with some of my friends in order to take care of her during my absence. I am in Chicago and I have been working as a designer for a company for two years. I have saved a great amount of money. It is enough to let us live a descent life during all the rest of our life. I have bought a wonderful house here in Chicago and envisage to call to my wife. I call her and announce her that I will come next week. She was crying when she heard my voice. When I arrive home I find her completely depressed. She does no more want to talk with me. She thinks that I have abandoned her harshly. I supply her to listen to me. I have brought with me a great bouquet of flowers. " You have no alibi to say". She says. She is both angry and sad. I try to appease the atmosphere but it is in vain. "I go and I intend to come back! You are all my life". I says. She does not want to look at me when I leave and she starts to cry. She has just get a new brush on her hip again because the first surgery has failed. I have paid the hospital in order that they put her such new one which is a performed brush.
I decide to pay for her a rest somewhere. I call our friend and give him the vacancy ticket and hotel reservation in Chicago Hotel. She thinks it is a donation from the hospital that is why she accepts it. The hotel is next to my home. Every day I come to her and I finish to contact her when she becomes cool. She likes the stay in such hotel and spends pleasant moments. We start to get breakfast and diner together and then we start to discuss about our life. She progressively forgives me. I invite her home and she likes it a lot. We decide to live together again there.
1122.title: A bright future awaits

12.content:
Wishes have wings,
or so I am told.
Perhaps that is why
wishes' dreams are so bold.

To lift from despair
a downtrodden soul,
wishes' wings need great strength
to achieve lofty goal.

To one who is weary
and down on his luck,
a dream must hold promise
that he'll rise from the muck.

So, if you should dream
of a change to your fate,
make wishes whose wings
help you grow and create.
12.title: Wishes have wings

121.content:
I once saw a man standing on the street who appeared to have nothing. His face told a story of sorrow and heartache. I felt compelled to stop by him.

"Sir, is there anything I can do to help you?"

He replied. "No thank you, I believe my dream has been answered. One act of kindness can make miracles happen.

I smiled and reached out my hand. "Very well then, it has been a pleasure."

As I walked away, the strangest feeling overcame me. I couldn't help but turn and look back. The man smiled at me, his sorrow seemed to have disappeared. The man no longer looked downtrodden and sorrowful; nor even in need.

I shook my head as if to focus where I was. Everything appeared to be normal but I wondered if I had been day dreaming.
121.title: Dream

choices: Suddenly there was an infestation of locusts

1214.content:
The man seems to be 80 years. The paradox is that it seems to me that he is familiar even though he remains a stranger. On the train I am thinking about my business that earns less. The concurrence is harsh and my computer trade will know failure in less than one month. Indeed I do not arrive to pay my debts and the workers team. The bank does not want to borrow me more.
Suddenly I find myself in a farm . It looks like my parents' one. It is completely empty. The home becomes just ruins. I am laying on an old bed full of dust. My father comes . He has white long beard and looks at me directly in my eyes and tells me this: "Henceforth this humble home is yours. This is where you will spend the rest of your life. The debts are in this earth. Take care my son." Then he disappears. Now I realize that he looks like a lot the man I saw previously.
Suddenly the train stops abruptly. I wake up quickly. I get out of the train. I arrive to the office and decide to make a wise decision. I declare failure and do the liquidation of my company. I change my project. I buy a great earth and start to cultivate plants. I decide to product natural nutritive both fruits and vegetables. Indeed I possess two diplomas one of agriculture and the other of chemistry. I have engaged some professional people in order to rise such project. I become a happy man and I have a great conviction in the success of such project that I named "Eat and heal with natural foods".

but there's a catch: manicured expectations.

The new baby squirms in the grass, licking dirt.

But verdant grass means tedious upkeep,

Box after box litters the lawn.

The dream life's in the concrete.

13.content:
Alex Naimon sat on the porch of his seaside villa, savoring the sunset and the yachts and boats on the waters. Next to his residence here, he had his marina on the sparkling waters of the Gulf. He was in a good mood. This was the end of a beautiful day and the taste of his Jack Daniels formed a welcome heat in his mouth.

This was a good time to plan the party. He had to entertain the big kahunas in town properly so that they would turn a blind eye to Alex's not so legal activities, such as narcotics trade, theft, prostitution, money laundering, among others. Maybe he had opened up too much, but business is business, and one can't say no to opportunities.

Thus the party. He tapped the side of his glass. 150 people would just about cut it, starting with the mayor, council members, chief of Police, and the CEOs of several local companies. Such good ideas Alex had just to keep his business growing.

He recalled how when Marlina Harker had OD'ed, the police chief had covered up for Alex by getting rid of a few documents that pointed out to his involvement with her. That man definitely needed more than an invitation to Alex's party. Maybe a boat from his Marina as a gift to him would warm the waters. He might even donate it to the police force, so people wouldn't talk.

In fact, he could donate "Heartbeats" to him. He had promised Heartbeats to Marlina, but of course, her death had taken care of that venture.

He placed his glass on the side table and rose to his feet. He would see to the success of the party personally, but first he had to make a few phone calls, so unwelcome coincidences or people wouldn't show up during his big bash.

He was especially uncomfortable about...
13.title: Heartbeats

choices: Alex decides to make the gift a big splash at the party
Heartbeats is burned to the waterline that night.
131.content:
Tony Ricci finding out. He was Alex's biggest rival and had been trying muscle in on Alex's business from the beginning. He even showed up at his door one day last week and bulled his way in. It seemed he felt that Alex needed a partner.

With some fancy delaying tactics, he'd managed to put him off. That wouldn't last for long. Maybe once he gave "Heartbeats" to the police department, he could get them to find something that would stick like Velcro to Tony and send him away, maybe even deport him. Alex smiled at the idea.

Ricci was smart, ruthless and had his own fingers in some of the same pockets Alex was trying to grease. But his rival didn't have "Heartbeats" as an ace up his sleeve. One of the fastest cigarette speedboats, it was really something!

Problem was Ricci was still sore for another reason. Marlina had once been Tony's squeeze. In fact, they'd been engaged when Alex had lured her away with promises and drugs.

Alex had enjoyed having Tony's ex until she became demanding of his time and especially his money. He'd been considering ways to get rid of her around the time she did it for him by overdosing on her own. But then again, Tony didn't like losing anything he considered his.

Maybe that was another way to get rid of him. Once he gave the boat to the chief, they'd have a chat about Tony. Alex had been considering giving it to the police force at the party, make a big splash like the philanthropist he pretended to be.
131.title: Rivalry

14.content:
Beautiful in Nightmares

On my stomach
I am crawling.
All of a sudden
I am falling.

Hearing aloud
myself
I am calling.
In my heart
dwells
forlorn longing.

Into an abyss
I am plunging.
My body is not
functioning ...

Will not listen to
my minds touching.
For I know not
what’s coming ...

Then I turn
but a fraction
of time watching
my decapitation.

The pain sharp,
a searing contraction.
Stunned am I,
my life an abstraction.

'Twas but an
earth quake,
death
becomes
birth
colored
opaque.

No time
to consider
the worth
to vacate,
For I know
frantically
that I must
first awake.

To keep
my children
within my sight,
Needing to
know they
will be alright.

I find myself
gathering
talisman
of the dead
creative,
talented.
Gladly given
by the
Shaman
of the Wise
Ancient
Salmon.

'Twas but a
thought projection
an elemental
electric collection
of formed matter
with reflection
choices, never
more than selection.

Through my mind
flows kinetics
filled with desire
and energetic,
avoiding the realm
of the catastrophic
with a charisma
I find quite poetic.

Tearing through
imperfect night,
to me ‘tis
as kryptonite.

Draining my
stamina of sight
I glimpse the
power of white.

‘Tis almost
polite
incredible
height.

As only one
can do
in spirit
I have only
to mirror it.
My soul will
adhere to it
with sounds
in silence..
prophetic.

Will I
to the other
begin
crossing over?
Hungry,
lost,
still
very much
a loner?

Will I be
scoffed
as is the
stoner?
or
Soft,
warm and
known unto
Her?

Beautiful you are in Nightmares ...
14.title: The dream I once had

choices: It was Malki's archenemy in the underworld
141.content:
Malki of Ba-Gan, the warlock parading as a jewel merchant, looked at the long line-up, examining the slaves for sale. Among them, his eyes settled on Rahika, a beauty well-fed though she might be. Her flaming red hair curling at the temples and eyes so black they might hold the curses of the entire witchdom took his breath away. He knew he had to have known her from somewhere, but where?

He asked the proprietor gap-toothed Ysati if he could have a word with one of the slaves before deciding on his purchase. Ysati nodded. "Yes, but why? Why would you want to talk to any slave?"

"I always talk to my slaves," Malki said. "In my business, a good tone of voice is important, especially because this slave will model my wares."

Then, Malki neared Rahika and talked to her in a language reminiscent of the hooting of owls, and Rahika answered him in the same language.

"So you're one of the cursed, too." Malki said. "Why this charade?"

"I have a bone to pick with someone, and only you could help. So I had myself put on sale since I knew you were looking for someone."

"Revenge is my favorite subject. Who is this someone?"

'"I'll tell you once you purchase me," said Rahika, her eyes sparkling with expectation, "and we cross over..."

"Crossing over to where?"

Rahika didn't answer. Still, a rotten deed Malki couldn't pass by. But who was the target of Rahika's furor and why?
141.title: Crossing over to where?

choices: Good thing he left instructions with his servant to buy!
Rahika was paraded by with a collar on and hurt expression.  What happened?
1411.content:
Malki had to ask himself if she could possibly be after him. No. It had been most of a century since that incident. He didn't know her directly, but likely, she would have some relation involved in it. He shivered pleasurably just remembering the outrage within the community of Warlocks and Witches alike. He had directly caused a whole community of the immortal and made them mortal! The best part was that they never saw it coming. Better, a cure was never found. More than likely, every one of them were dead now, a victim of their own lifestyle. Of course, Malki had taken many precautions to protect himself after this event. Naturally, he was top of the hit list, but, at the same time, not many were willing to chance what he would do to those who failed.

         Even as careful as he was, he was surprised when he got too close to her and she was able to lightly brush his wrist just above his glove with her arm. It seemed wholly an accident as another had bumped into her, causing her to stumble into him. Of course, he couldn't take any chances and went immediately into the washroom to wash. Water was a great neutralizer, especially when used with salts. Skin contact was made and he worried over it. He left for the wash room.

         Not realizing the loss of time, he came back and the auction was over. Where did she get herself to?
1411.title: It was Malki himself

choices: Malki decides to try and get to Rahika and find out the truth.
He begins to feel strange. The wrist Rahika touched is swollen and inflamed.
14114.content:
Malki knew he hadn't been gone that long. But somehow Rahika had been caught doing something she shouldn't have. He couldn't decide whether he was happy or sad about it. But he needed to know exactly what she'd done.

Malki decided there was only one way to find out. He approached the security detail that had Rahika in tow. When he asked what she had done, they told him she had gone in the back of the auction room and tried to steal something.

Malki stared at Rahika. She wasn't looking at him. When he asked what she had tried to steal, the guards got suspicious of him, so he was forced to leave and move away. There had been several things in the auction that the less scrupulous might try to steal.

The question was, it he were Rahika, what would he want so badly that he might try to steal it. Why had she had such a hurt expression? Then it struck him, she must have believed that he had turned her in!
14114.title: Rahika was paraded by with a collar on and hurt...

Malki is the most wealthy man of Baghy. Baghy is a great island in India. He possesses golden,emerald and diamond mines. As he possesses many farms and lands. Malki is widower from his first and second marriage. He has never loved both wives he first took as spouses.I was just policy marriages. Alone he has not arrived yet to find his true love.
Malki fell in love at the first sight of Rahika. Rahika feels something towards him too but vengeance has rendered her blind. Mourayre killed his father five years ago and took all his goods. Rahika's dad was a maharaja of Bouhine Island which is close to Baghy. Now Mourayre named himself maharaja of the island. He thinks he deserves the throne because Rahika's dad the maharaja Tadje Moule had no sons and he is the first paternal cousin to Tadje Moule. Rahika is a widower too. She led a sad life even though being first wealthy and still young. Rahika sees in Malki all her hope. She thinks all her dreams will come true. Malki feels such nice personality of Rahika and thinks she is a fine woman. When discussing with her closely he realizes she is smart too. He does not want to render her a slave even though he bought her .He wants her to be free again. So he asks her to become his right woman because she has already got governance experience with her father and knows well how to lead policy affairs. Of the endless great game
Of global chess

Shoot the bastard! Kill it! Keep the 20th century dead!

Tokyo took over the east
Defeated in war
Reemerging decades later
To challenge

Shoot the bastard! Kill it! Keep the 20th century dead!

The Great Satan
Does not know he is the great Satan
Thinks he is the Great Pumpkin
Thinks the world loves him
For his money

The world does not care
All they want is to be shown
The money

Shoot the bastard! Kill it! Keep the 20th century dead!

The evil dance
Continues and continues
Money, Money
Rules the world

Art, beauty, love
All of sale to the highest bidder

The poor suffer
Some get bought
Others get sold

Some blow things up
Just for fun

Shoot the bastard! Kill it! Keep the 20th century dead!

And the world turns
Does not care
The world turns and turns
And turns

While these foolish creatures
Rant and rave and kill and live
And die

God acts as if he has run away
From the horrid hell that he has wrought
Perhaps he has
Perhaps the End times have come and gone
But we don't know it.

Shoot the bastard! Kill it! Keep the 20th century dead!

Each day another 100 million people
Are born to someday die

Meanwhile
Their shit accumulates
And pollutes and kills
And the world spins on and on
Around the Sun

And so the 20th century ends
As it began

Great illusions abound
The new economy
Endless prosperity
Endless happiness
End of history

And other nonsense
Fills the airwaves

Shoot the bastard! Kill it! Keep the 20th century dead!

And somewhere
Another HITLERSTALINEMAO stands
Ready to overthrow the world
To create a new paradise on earth
And hell for everyone who has to live in it

Big Brother watches us all
For profit
Governments merely tools
Of the Big Corporate Giants
Who rule the world now

Shoot the bastard! Kill it! Keep the 20th century dead!

And like the Giant dinosaurs
One day will be overthrown

And to that end I finally say
Good riddance to the 20th Century
Quick shoot it put it out of its misery.
Destroy the beast
Before it wakes up and destroys us

The 21st Century emerges
From the dust of the destruction of the old older
Perhaps wiser
Perhaps better
More like more of the same old stench of hell

As the world turns
And turns and turns
Spinning around the Sun
In the darkest deep despair
Of Hell on earth

Shoot the bastard! Kill it! Keep the 20th century dead!

With that thought
I turn off CNN
And turn to the Three Stooges and ask
Again
What does it mean?
Curly says Certainty
And with that I wake up
Face the sun

And say
21st Century
I am glad you are here
Please shoot the last century
And start a new

And only laugher
Comes across the Internet
The laughter of the insane
The world spins and spins and spins
It's crazy way through hell


And we live and die and hope and dream
And pray to our gods for deliverance
From evil

The gods laugh and laugh and play on
Who cares what happens to the little people?

Shoot the bastard! Kill it! Keep the 20th century dead!

Someday
Someone will show the gods
What happens when the little people
Wake up
And destroy the world
In order to save it!

The world shrugs and spins and spins and spins
And CNN ABCNBCCBSFOXPACCNBCMSNBMS.COMAOLYAHOOEXCITE
Blather on and on and on and on

Shoot the bastard! Kill it! Keep the 20th century dead!
144.title: 20th Century is over

choices: Assets in the front, "Kick Me" sign in the back
1443.content:
Browsing through my extensive collection of saved links and posts, I contemplate what I'm going to move from private storage into an area my friends will be able to peruse at their leisure. Of course, peruse my be the wrong word here. After all, I'm the kind of woman who considers a 38 minute article on the potential pilot suicide at the root of the Malaysian Airlines crash to be light reading. I'm not afraid of sinking my teeth into a detailed plan for boosting 5G security. Simply put, I'm the kind of reader that is nerdy enough to get a "Kick Me" sign nailed to my back. The only reason that hasn't happened is likely attached to my chest and required plenty of core exercising to prevent backaches.

But how did I end up walking this incredibly strange Boring America tightrope? I grew up watching Cheers with my parents and got a Spice Girls CD for Christmas once upon a time, for the love of everything. I should have walked down the pop culture path. My teenage ambition of screenwriting should have pushed me down that hill to the point of major facial lacerations and bruising. Somehow, I kept from stumbling down that detail-laden rabbit hole, almost ended up in politics, and now spend my time working on a gospel of media analysis and telling Americans to check themselves. I ask them if they are actually angry or if they are picking up on (manufactured) anger around them. What is at the root of their anger? Is it a headline saying, "She moved home to save money — and her mom never wants her to leave"? Or is it that people are too busy yelling thesaurus-formed insults at each other and not actually listening for valuable points in opposite opinions? I have decided that my activism is calling people out on how they're consuming media, because we're all pretty bad at. Let's be real here.

I realize that I'm not ready to push these links to my friends. Hell, the ones I do share don't really get much response. At the same time, I recognize that I'll never really be ready. I have to keep putting the information out there. I have to continue leading the metaphorical horses to water. I need to continue giving them something to drink. They may prefer the bubbly sugar water offered by pop culture and persuasive activists. A cool, clean drink of checking impulsive, emotional responses is much healthier, though. All the same, I know I can't force their mouths to the sugar-free water without looking like I'm drowning them. Still, I'm going to share my collection of Media Analysis links so I can continue to at least do my due diligence.
1443.title: Continues and continues

choices: Having a drink with me, now?
We get off the elevator, now.
You help me write an office memo
145.content:
The department had almost emptied out when Emma finally turned off her computer and reached for her jacket decisively. She would do her grocery shopping before she'd step in her lonely apartment, this evening.

That she didn't have someone waiting for her or someone she'd like to cook for didn't exist anymore didn't matter. This weekend would be different. She would treat herself as if she mattered with or without a partner.

Her eyes caught the beautiful beach photo on the wall of a man and a woman watching a Caribbean sunset with their heads touching. She shrugged as she slipped her hand into the side pocket of her jacket to check if her wallet is still here. Good!

The elevator was crowded. She slid to the side and leaned at its wall, closing her eyes.
soon she'd be out on the street, smelling the spring rain and getting soaked.Why didn't she wear her raincoat in the morning!

"You must be tired!"

She looked up at him. Golden skin, honey-colored eyes, golden curls. Tall, too! Yes, of course, the new communications officer. She remembered him being introduced during the week to her floor by Kate, the CEO. What was his name? Joshua something.

"The end of the week," she tried to smile so to act friendly..

"I'm Joshua Sterling, and you?"

She shifted on her feet. "Emma Walker, I work on the fourth floor."

"I remember," he said. "I saw you during the introduction."

She touched her hand to her forehead. "I remember your being introduced, too. Welcome to the company. I guess you'll be, you are, working on the sixth floor or am I wrong?"

"Yes, that's what Kate said."

Emma wasn't sure why he was talking to her. She also wasn't sure she liked Joshua's smug, well-adjusted look. If Emma were to be a new worker in a company this size, she'd want to sink into the floor to not be seen. In fact, that's what she had done three years ago, even though Jen, her childhood friend, was working here, also. But it was then, and Jen had moved on.

"I bet you'll have a great weekend after a long week," Joshua said. "Any interesting plans?"

"Oh, you know..." she said undecidedly, looking at the other people in the elevator, listening in their conversation. The nerve of them! Suddenly she decided to tell the truth. "My weekends are as boring as my working days." She chuckled at her own brazenness.

He smiled. "I can't believe that, but taking your word for it, how about...."
145.title: The Smell of Spring Rain

choices: Noise could be heard coming from outside
Knitting in the old rocking chair
1451.content:
"Would you like to come to my apartment for a drink?" Emma decided to ask as they rode on the elevator.

"Sure. I have some time on the weekend," Joshua replied.

"I'll see you then," Emma said as the elevator stopped on her floor.

Emma Walker walked out of the building into the spring rain. The smell of the rain felt cheerful and welcoming. Then she hurried along to the store to buy some groceries. This weekend will be the time she will have Joshua over for company, a change in the way things were going currently. At the store, she found the groceries she wanted to buy and then headed on over to her apartment.

The door creaked open after she unlocked it and pulled on the door. She had the whole apartment for herself. When she went inside she walked over to the kitchen and set down the groceries. Then she started to put the groceries away. One lonely evening coming up for her time unless someone decides to drop by.
1451.title: Having a drink with me, now?

14511.content:
Emma is excited to receive Joshua tomorrow. She has prepared a delicious diner and some singular decorations on the table. It has been one week that she has been preparing for such meeting. Joshua was supposed to come at six PM. Emma has just finished the dinner. She has prepared roasted chicken with some rice. As she has prepared a mix of vegetables cooked with some both butter and cheese in the oven. The dessert was a mix of fruits with some black chocolate. Tea will be prepared with some mint tonight. She puts on a cute long black dress decorated with silver pearls. Emma is waiting with fervor Joshua. She cannot forget how much both tenderness and care he showed for her when she was ill. But time passed quickly and it is six thirty PM and Joshua has not come yet. She becomes nervous and worried in the same time. When it is a quarter to seven she decides to call when a ring is heard at the door. She feels the impression as if Joshua appeared. When she opens the door her neighbor Sally is at the door. Good afternoon Emma! How are you? Emma smiles to her neighbor even though she is completely nervous and angry. Hello! Sally how are you! Pleased to meet you! Emma I have found this next to my door. It is for you but someone has put it there accidentally. Thank you so much Sally! It is really kind of you.
Emma closes the door and opens the great perfumed box addressed to her. On it a great red heart is drawn and inside it is written :Emma. The box is white and wrapped with a red velvet node. She opens it and finds some fresh lovely tulips.She finds a beautiful rose card too. It is written: " Dear Emma! Sorry I cannot come tonight. Take care and preserve your lovely smile that I always need. Yours, Joshua!"
14511.title: Joshua Sterling appears

choices: Instead, he called later that night.
She woke to her ringing phone.
1452.content:
" ... I call you tomorrow? Maybe we can do something to liven up your weekend."

She looked into his honey-colored eyes to try and determine whether or not he was just teasing her or if he was truly serious. Oh, what am I thinking? He's not my type. Given his smugness, it would be a safe bet he's just being placating.

"I don't think so, Joshua. My weekends may be boring but that doesn't mean I don't have things to do." She felt self-conscious with everyone in the elevator listening to their conversation, but what could they do? They were in a small box.

"C'mon. I know you've probably got things to do, but you have to eat, right? I'd like to take you out for lunch. What's your favorite restaurant?"

Why was he doing this? Surely he wasn't interested in her. She couldn't figure it out and was too tired to try any harder. Letting out a small sigh she said, "Thank you, Josuha. That's kind of you, but I'm really tired and I just want to go home and go to sleep."

"Well, I hope you'll eat something before you do."

What does he care if I eat? That's such a weird statement. "Maybe. Anyway, I appreciate the gesture. I think I'll stick with my boring weekend for now."

The elevator arrived on the ground floor. Joshua allowed everyone else to get out before him and he motioned for Emma to step out as well. She stepped out of the elevator and headed for the parkinng garage. He kept up with her and said, "Okay. May I walk you to your car?"

She looked over at him. He moved his briefcase from one hand to the other. "If you'd like." She felt a little tickle in her belly and wondered what that could be from. {I'm probably hungry after talking about eating in the elevator.

He walked her to her car and before she got in he asked, "Well, may I call you tomorrow? Just to talk."

This guy isn't going to take no for an answer. She relented. "Sure."

She gave him her number and slid into her car. "Have a good weekend."
1452.title: I call you tomorrow?"

choices: Joshua's another job is a scam.
Joshua has been kidnapped by the Mafia
Emma tries to replace Joshua in her life.
1454.content: Emma is a single woman and is really bored of not finding her love. When she first saw Joshua she saw him like a work mate only. But when she meets him again and proposed him a work collaboration she quickly understands that Joshua shows some interest towards her and thinks that her relationship could go further. So she agrees. They both quickly feel that they collaborate very well and in a spontaneous way. They spend their working moments in a cool ambience full of friendship. Emma is happy to have Joshua as a work mate and when he is absent she feels loneliness. Today Emma is ill. She catches influenza. Joshua calls her but she does not respond. He is sad. He decides to visit her at home. He comes worried and angry. He is upset how Emma has not called him for help. Friends are supposed to help. Isn't it Emma? He brings her medicines and cares about her a lot. Before leaving her home he asks her to let her phone open because he will call the night. When she is completely cured she realizes how much Joshua did for her. He becomes her best friend. When she comes back to the office she finds Joshua office empty. They tell her that he has left for another job. She starts to cry. She thinks it is her fault. She is completely upset and sad and does not know what to do.
1454.title: You help me write an office memo

15.content:
Words are Important
For they are how I
Am able to write this
Rather rough poem
Which is a Free-Form
Style type poem.

I doubt I'll be
Rewarded for
My entry
As I am
Now a Yellow Case

But I was black
For the better part
Of nine long years

In that time
I've wrote a lot
Love and Romance
Horror and Gore
And still more

So words are important
Use them wisely
And have some
Fun along the way
15.title: Words are important

154.content:
A man's best friend might be a dog—
loyal, loving, effervescent—but I know better.
Amber eyes slitted, sleepy, you lounge
on the end of my bed, in the dip of my spine,
beside me, quiet and at peace—and we are home.
We were both lost, once. Displaced
at odds and in pain, ashamed
of things we could not control. In November,
when the wind had teeth and the shriveled gold
grass became knives in the morning, you
cried out, your voice ten times bigger than your body—
for hours. And there I was, afraid of the sound
of the request to be something to someone
even someone so small as you. Maybe we are both
fortunate I opened the door to let in the dark. Feral and fiery
you stumbled inside, a thunderstorm on four feet,
ounce-for-ounce a tiny, hissing terror. The world had not
been kind to you. The fleas had left wounds,
your body a battleground, gritty with it, and you
only eight weeks old. You had no reason
to trust the hand that reached to feed you,
the arms to hold you. Five minutes and
I was yours, as you toppled to the ground
to show me your wild black belly, let me touch
—uninterrupted, such trust—to feel the purrs
that rocked you.
154.title: Man's Best Friend

choices: There really aren't a puppets on Sesame Street
1542.content:
Is your body a battleground?
Have you had wars fought on your chest,
So heavy and catastrophic that your breath can't be found?
Did you fight for your own justice?

I have, over and over again,
The warriors love to invade my personal space.
Eventually they kill each other and it ends,
And I'm the victor once again; another trophy for my mental case.
1542.title: body a battleground

choices: One piece missing in a jigsaw puzzle
155.content:
The mirror keeps me doubled over
as i brush my teeth each day.
It's the fear of seeing myself sober
after all these years, what part of me remains?

i know i have to let the light in.
Have to set all this self-hatred free.
Rid myself of a dozen years of violence,
and somehow convince myself that I'm Still Me.
155.title: I'm Still Me

1551.content:
Failure and deception invaded my past
Like bad luck that was stuck
Sun was erased from my sky
I was no more me

Each part of the mirror bears a fact
But such light that constantly reflects
Like a sun ray which is shinning
Within a cloudy and gray sky

The mirror becomes like a diamond
A strong language it bears
Hope is settled overall
Whenever ocean tide lasts

The mirror becomes my friend
On me it reflects its light
Showing me the other side of me
But much dare I do need to believe in me
1551.title: Daybreak

info.brief_description: An interactive writing project for all Cases
info.description:
Welcome to First-Choice, a scrapbook for all Cases.




To celebrate Writing.com's 19th Birthday, during the entire month of September 2019, each chapter of at least four sentences will receive 1000 gps, with three additions allowed per writer per day. All other rules will also apply.


Please do not forget to add, under your chapter, writing-choices as titles, for others after you so they can write, too. This is an ongoing activity and it should never reach an end.




         Since I have been getting several requests from gray cases asking to be allowed to write in "Write-Baton" , I decided to make a similar book for them alone; then, I thought better of it and decided to open it up for all cases. I hope you have a good time with it!




Before you write your addition, please READ the rules.

At the time of writing inside this interactive, you may be carrying a case of any color.

Please keep the content rating on or under 18+. (For information on content rating please check "Content Rating System (CRS)" .

This is an interactive item. It means you’ll add chapters to an existing thread. For general information on interactives, please read "Interactive Story" 

You may add a chapter once a day. There will be a small prize (500 gift points) for each deserving entry. For information on gps, please check "Gift Points" 

In First Choice, you may write as long as you wish, but your piece has to fit the title in the choice line you have picked, and to qualify for a reward, it needs to have four sentences or more.

You will have to use the word or phrase or idea in the choice line inside your piece.

You may write whatever you choose (poem, prose, fiction, non-fiction, essay, story, scene...etc, but not an entire novel in the same addition for obvious reasons) .

I also started three storylines for those who want to continue writing on a plotline. With these threads, please continue with the storyline.
A murder/mystery starting with "Heartbeats" 
A horror/witch story starting with "Crossing over to where?" 
A love/romance starting with "The Smell of Spring Rain" 

Other threads are free for you to write what you wish.

Before you go, you will leave any words or phrases on the choice lines for the next person.

You HAVE TO add two or more choice lines before you go. Please do not try to put an end to any thread. If you do, I'll edit to add other options.

Leave only one word, one phrase or one half-finished sentence per choice line. You may use common or proper nouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs as you choose.

Please refrain from writing anything derogatory against any one known person, group, nation, or religion. Those types of entries will be deleted.

The choices as to the genre and type are entirely yours, but Do NOT spam. Make your writing count. Spams will be deleted.



Enjoy!
